GUI module¶

This module brings everything together and handles all of the functional requirements as well as non functional requirements. The classes include the MainWindow as well as classes for multi threading.

class GUI.MainWindow(defaultFilename=None, defaultPrefdefClassFile=None)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QMainWindow, GUI.WindowMixin

This class handles the entire GUI.

FIT_WIDTH = 1¶
FIT_WINDOW = 0¶
MANUAL_ZOOM = 2¶
addLabel(shape)¶

Add a label (corresponding to the recently drawn shape) to the label list. :param shape: The shape that corresponds to the label.

addRecentFile(filePath)¶

Add a file to the recent file list after it is opened. :param filePath: The path to the file that was just opened.

addZoom(increment=10)¶

Zoom in. :param increment: how much to zoom in.

adjustScale(initial=False)¶
advanced()¶
Returns:True if the GUI is in advanced mode. False otherwise.
beginner()¶
Returns:True if the GUI is in beginner mode. False otherwise.
changeSavedir(_value=False)¶

Change default save directory. The default save directory is where annotations for all loaded images (via open dir) will be saved. :param _value: Whether there is a default save directory given or not.

chooseColor1()¶

Open a color dialog and set the line color to the selected color.

chooseColor2()¶

Open a color dialog and set the fill color to the selected color.

chshapeFillColor()¶

Open a color dialog and set the fill color to the selected color.

chshapeLineColor()¶

Open a color dialog and set the line color to the selected color.

closeEvent(event)¶

This is called whenever the user clicks the close button. The image is closed and all of the annotations are reset. :param event: The close event (button click).

closeFile(_value=False)¶

Called whenever the image is closed.

copySelectedShape()¶

Copy the currently selected shape and display it offset from the original by a few pixels.

copyShape()¶

Copy the currently selected shape.

createShape()¶

Create a shape on the canvas.

currentItem()¶
Returns:The currently selected label.
currentPath()¶
Returns:The currently open path if one is opened. Otherwise return the location of the program.
deleteSelectedShape()¶

Delete the currently selected shape. Display a confirmation dialog to ensure the user meant to hit delete.

discardChangesDialog()¶

Display a dialog to the user to ensure that they actually want to proceed without saving.

editLabel(item=None)¶

This occurs when the user clicks edit label on a particular bounding box. :param item: The item that the user is editing the label for.

errorMessage(title, message)¶

Display an error message pop up box. :param title: The string to display on the title bar of the dialog box. :param message: The message to display in the dialog box. :return: The dialog box.

exportAsXML(_value=False)¶

Export the annotations as a xml file.

exportXMLDialog()¶

Opens up a file dialog for the user to select where to save the XML file.

fileitemDoubleClicked(item=None)¶

This event is triggered whenever the user double clicks on an image in the image list. :param item: The item that the user clicked on.

getComponentPredictions()¶
Display the dialog box where the user can select the components to get the predicted boxes for.
This accesses the individual caffe model for the component that the user selects.
hasLabels()¶
Returns:True if the image has labels. False otherwise.
labelItemChanged(item)¶

This event is triggered whenever the user changes the label associated with a shape. :param item: The item in the label list.

labelSelectionChanged()¶

This event triggers whenever the user selects a new label in the label list.

loadFile(filePath=None)¶

Load the specified image. Also load the annotations if the default annotation dir is specified. :param filePath: The path to the image. :return: True if load is successful. False otherwise.

loadLabels(shapes)¶

Load labels based on the shapes that are given. :param shapes: The shapes to load the labels for.

loadPascalXMLByFilename(xmlPath)¶

Load annotation boxes from a xml file. :param xmlPath: The path to the xml file.

loadPredefinedClasses(predefClassesFile)¶

Load the contents of the text file into the label selection dialog box as labels to select. :param predefClassesFile: The path to the file to load the labels from.

loadRecent(filename)¶
loadTXTByFilename(txtPath)¶

Load annotation boxes from a txt file. :param txtPath: The path to the text file.

mayContinue()¶

Return true if there are no unsaved boxes on the image.

moveShape()¶

Move the currently selected shape.

newShape()¶

Pop-up and give focus to the label editor.

Position MUST be in global coordinates.

noShapes()¶
Returns:True if there are no shapes currently drawn. False otherwise.
openAnnotation(_value=False)¶

Open the annotation file. This method display a dialog box and asks the user to select a txt or xml file. The method will then call the appropriate loadTXT or loadXML method based on the user’s selection. :param _value: Whether an annotation is loaded or not.

openDir(_value=False)¶

Open all images in a specified directory. :param _value: Whether a directory is opened or not.

openFile(_value=False)¶
This method displays a dialog box that prompts the user to select an image. Then it calls the loadFile method
with the given image as a parameter.
openNextImg(_value=False)¶

Open the next image in the image list if there is a directory of images open.

openPrevImg(_value=False)¶

Open previous image if there is a directory of images open.

Populate the label list menu.

populateModeActions()¶

Changes the tool bar and based on whether the tool is in advanced mode or beginner mode.

Remove a label and delete the shape. :param shape: The shape to delete and remove the label for.

resetState()¶

Reset everything about the stored GUI information, including the annotation boxes, image, and save files.

resizeEvent(event)¶
saveFile()¶

Method to export annotations to a text file of the form: class x(top left corner) y width height where class= 1-ic; 2-capacitor; 3-resistor; 4-inductor; 5-sscapactitor

saveFileAs(_value=False)¶

Save the file regardless of whether the image is dirty or clean. :param _value: :return:

saveFileDialog()¶

Open the file dialog to save text files. The user selects the location to save the file. :return:

saveLabels(annotationFilePath)¶

Save the labels in the file path currently specified. This is for XML files. :param annotationFilePath: The path to save the file to.

scaleFitWidth()¶
scaleFitWindow()¶

Figure out the size of the pixmap in order to fit the main widget.

scanAllImages(folderPath)¶

Scan all of the images in the given directory path and sort them (ignore case). :param folderPath: The directory to load the images from. :return: A list of the images paths.

scrollRequest(delta, orientation)¶

This handles the scroll bar.

setAdvanced()¶

Change the tool bar so that the advanced mode buttons are displayed.

setBeginner()¶

Change the tool bar so that the beginner mode buttons are displayed.

setClean()¶

Set dirty mode to false. Clean means that every drawn box is saved in a file.

setCreateMode()¶

Set create mode while the user is in advanced mode. This happens when the user clicks the create mode button.

setDirty()¶

Set dirty mode to true. Dirty means that there are boxes drawn that are not currently saved.

setEditMode()¶

Set edit mode while the user is in the edit mode. This happens when the user clicks the edit mode button. :return:

setFitWidth(value=True)¶

Set the image to fit horizontally inside of the canvas. :param value: Whether the image is fit horizontally or not.

setFitWindow(value=True)¶

This event is called whenever the user select ‘fit to window’ :param value: Whether ‘fit to window’ is selected or not.

setZoom(value)¶

Set the zoom of the image to the given value. :param value: The amount of zoom.

shapeSelectionChanged(selected=False)¶

This event is triggered when the user clicks on a new shape. :param selected: boolean value that tells whether a shape is selected.

status(message, delay=5000)¶

Display a given message on the status bar. :param message: The message to display on the status bar. :param delay: The amount of time (in ms) to wait before displaying the message.

toggleActions(value=True)¶

Enable/Disable widgets which depend on an opened image.

toggleAdvancedMode(value=True)¶

Toggle advanced mode so that users can draw multiple boxes without having to interact with the label dialog box each time. In advanced mode, the user selects the label and then can draw multiple boxes with that label. :param value: The boolean value that tells whether to set advanced mode or not.

toggleDrawMode(edit=True)¶

This is a helper function for setCreateMode and setEditMode. It toggles beginner/advanced mode. :param edit: bool value that tells whether edit mode is enabled or not.

toggleDrawingSensitive(drawing=True)¶

In the middle of drawing, toggling between modes should be disabled.

togglePolygons(value)¶

Toggle all of the polygons to visible/invisible based on the value. :param value: Whether the shapes are shown or not. :return:

tutorial()¶

This is called whenever the user clicks on help. Not yet implemented, as no tutorial doc exists yet.

updateFileMenu()¶

Update the file menu whenever the user opens a new image. Add the file to the recently opened list.

zoomRequest(delta)¶

This event is called whenever the user zooms in/out.

class GUI.WorkerSignals¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtCore.QObject

Defines the signals available from a running worker thread.

Supported signals are:

finished
No data
error
tuple (exctype, value, traceback.format_exc() )
result
object data returned from processing, anything
progress
int indicating % progress
error¶
finished¶
progress¶
result¶

GUI.get_main_app(argv=[])¶

Standard boilerplate Qt application code. Do everything but app.exec_() – so that we can test the application in one thread
